print.color
Class ColoredPrinter

java.lang.Object
  print.color.ColoredPrinter
All Implemented Interfaces:
ColoredPrinterI, PrinterI
public class ColoredPrinter
extends java.lang.Object
implements ColoredPrinterI

If you want to create a Colored Printer this is the only class you should use. This is your Colored Printers Factory and it abstracts the creation of a Colored Printer and its real implementation. It offers two types of constructors, one for static and other for dynamic printers. If you use the static constructor you will use one implementation offered by the library. If you use the dynamic constructor you must pass as argument an instance of any class that implements ColoredPrinterI interface.

Version:
1.25 beta
Author:
Diogo Nunes

          Builder pattern: allows the caller to specify the attributes that it wants to change and keep the default values in the others.
